conversation.content:
[very excited] Wait, wait, wait—are we actually done? [pause] Like, completely done? [laugh] I keep looking at the board and there's nothing left. [extremely happy] Twenty-third of December and we're DONE! [long pause] This is... I mean, this has never happened in what, fifteen years? [whispering] I don't even know what to do with myself. [laugh loudly] 

Look, I was prepared to be here until, you know, probably midnight on Christmas Eve like every other year. [exhausted] My back is killing me, sure, but we actually did it. [relieved] No more angry customers calling about delayed packages, no more overtime until 2 AM, no more— [gasp] oh my God, I can actually go to my daughter's recital tomorrow! [happy] She's gonna flip when I tell her.

[quickly] Remember last year when Marco literally slept in the break room for three nights straight? [chuckle] And now look at us—home before dinner for once. [warm] Honestly, this team is just... we really pulled it off, didn't we? [very sincerely] I'm so proud of everyone. 

[shouting] Someone needs to take a picture of that empty warehouse floor! [delighted] History right there, people!

subject: Your packer team finishing the holiday rush early for the first time in company history
